text.p: The following are the main stories from Monday morning's Austrian newspapers:
- An opinion poll shows that 52 percent of Austrians are unhappy with the direction in which the country is developing. Only eight percent are satisfied with the government's performance.
- A law extending shop opening hours should kick start the employment market next year. Shops will need more part-time workers.
- Austria's biggest mail order firm Quelle is to build a new centre in Linz.
- Austria's car leasing firms face tough competition and a stagnating market over the next few years.
- Defence Minister Werner Fasslabend says he will press ahead with the purchase of new army tanks, despite opposition from coalition partner the Social Democrats.
- The finance ministry and central bank will begin calculating the effects of black market labour on gross domestic product early next year.
- Employment instead of welfare. Social Affairs Minister Franz Hunms wants to involve those on benefit in community service.
